= Release Notes =

== 1.1.3 ==

  * Added support for updating Jetty 7's sessions last access time with out refreshing the connection.
  * Support for IE client side message batch processing. (Changes the IE message protocol)
  * Support for using arrays as a serialized message type. (requires two issues to be fixes in GWT [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/issues/detail?id=1822 1922] and [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/issues/detail?id=4657 4657])
  * Removed System.out debugging issue 1
  * Improved specific server fall back code.
  * Fixed session creation logic r99
  * Improved session creation logic r100

== 1.1.2 ==

  * Fixed "Unexpected disconnection" error when disconnecting {{{HTTPRequestCometTransport}}} from the client side.

== 1.1.1 ==

  * Support for connecting across sub domains in all browsers.
  * Support for connecting across all domains in all browsers except IE.

== 1.1.0 ==

  * Support for GWT 2.0. Not compatible with GWT 1.7 or earlier.
  * Support for [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/wiki/RpcDirectEval direct-eval RPC]. see [GettingStarted#Receiving_GWT_Serialized_Types Receiving GWT Serialized Types]

== 1.0.12 ==

  * Added support for updating Catalina/Tomcat 5.5's sessions last access time with out refreshing the connection.

== 1.0.11 ==

  * Added support for updating Catalina/Tomcat 6.0's sessions last access time with out refreshing the connection.
  * Cleaned up the Comet test cases.
  * Added support for overlapping requests to mask connection refresh establishment latency.

== 1.0.10 ==

  * Fixed an issue where the deflater was not flushing everything for large chunks of data.
  * Improved the performance of compression by not computing Adler check sum. IE does not support these anyway.
  * Named the heartbeat thread for easier diagnosis.
  * Cleaned up the Comet test cases.

== 1.0.9 ==

  * Added support for keeping the HTTP session alive when only the comet connection is in use and no other client HTTP requests are being made which would normally cause the HTTP session to timeout. [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-comet/source/detail?r=28 r28] [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-comet/source/detail?r=29 r29]

== 1.0.8 ==

  * Fixed an issue with {{{HTTPRequestCometTransport}}}'s handling of server side errors. [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-comet/source/detail?r=23 r23]
  * Made a change to ensure there is only one active {{{CometResponse}}} per {{{CometSession}}} [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-comet/source/detail?r=24 r24]
